result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with release for work, work search, child care and therapy
Probation may be transferred to Brown County

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 6 months of probation or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete additional community service as approved by the agent. Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

No contact with the Target Store listed in the criminal complaint

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia

Complete a Parenting class

Obtain a valid driver's license within the first 6 months of probation

No new law violations

timeConds.notes: Complete 50 hours of community service (5 hours of community service per month of probation commencing with December of 2022)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty. Paul Bucher
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:00 AM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
State filed an amended information.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by defendant.
Defendant is/not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is/not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
6 Months Huber with RELEASE FOR WORK, WORK SEARCH, CHILD CARE AND THERAPY.  (Credit - 0 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year.  Probation may be transferred to Brown County.
Conditions of Probation:
-	No contact with the Target Store listed in the criminal complaint;
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	No Use or Possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	Complete a Parenting Class;
-	Maintain employment;
-	Obtain a valid Driver's License within the first 6 months of probation; 
-	Complete 50 hours community service (5 hours of community service per month of probation commencing with December 2022);
-	No new law violations;

RESTITUTION: $ 0 (zero)

COSTS:  $ 243.00

DRGOD Surcharge: $ 10.00

DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation within the first 6 months of probation / during term of imprisonment and during extended supervision. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.  As an alternative to payment the defendant may complete additional community service as approved by the Agent.  Each hour of community service to equal $25.00 towards financial obligations.
Letter to Court dated October 19, 2022 - Defense Request for Plea and Sentence Date, filed by Atty. Bucher

Jury status hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Letter to Court dated August 18, 2022 re: DA asking for adjournment.

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 19, 2022 - APPROVED - Clerk to reschedule with parties.**
Defendant's Motion in Limine
State's Motion in Limine
State's Proposed Jury Instructions
State's Witness List.
Trial Order signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 6/20/22

Jury status hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:23 AM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests matter be set for trial.
Jury trial expected to last 1 day.  Court will select an alternater juror.  Clerk to prepare a trial order.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Hans Naker, of the Village of Menomonee Falls Police Department, sworn in and testfies on direct by ADA Farina.
Cross examination by attorney Bucher.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.

01:16 PM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant to pay $ 50 monthly, commencing on 4/15/2022. (BC)
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:07 AM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and informs defendant to fill out the paperwork and turn it into the clerk's office prior to leaving the courthouse today.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Target/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:05 PM Defendant Shaquanda T Campbell Nicholson in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court provides the defendant with two copies of the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and she is to fill out the paperwork and return it to the Clerk's office prior to the next date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
